# Reference

<!-- DO NOT EDIT: This document was generated by Puppet Strings -->

## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`antelope`](#antelope): Manages the Antelope Real-Time Environmental Monitoring suite
* [`antelope::mco`](#antelope--mco): Install Antelope MCollective plugins
* [`antelope::service_fact`](#antelope--service_fact): Installs a service fact for Antelope services
* [`antelope::sync`](#antelope--sync): Installs a synchronization script for copying Antelope installations

### Defined types

* [`antelope::instance`](#antelope--instance): Installs and manages an Antelope real-time system instance
* [`antelope::rtsystemdir`](#antelope--rtsystemdir): Manages permissions inside an Antelope real-time system directory
* [`antelope::versioned_license_pf`](#antelope--versioned_license_pf): Creates a license.pf parameter file for a specific Antelope version
* [`antelope::versioned_site_pf`](#antelope--versioned_site_pf): Creates a site.pf parameter file for a specific Antelope version

### Data types

* [`Antelope::Dirs`](#Antelope--Dirs): A type alias for Antelope real-time system directory paths
* [`Antelope::Group`](#Antelope--Group): A type alias for group names or GIDs
* [`Antelope::Instances`](#Antelope--Instances): A type alias for Antelope instance configurations
* [`Antelope::Synchost`](#Antelope--Synchost): A type alias for rsync hostnames
* [`Antelope::User`](#Antelope--User): A type alias for user names or UIDs
* [`Antelope::Version`](#Antelope--Version): A type alias for Antelope version strings

## Classes

### <a name="antelope"></a>`antelope`

This class manages Antelope Real-Time Environmental Monitoring software
from Boulder Real-Time Technologies. It supports Antelope versions 5.9
through 5.15 on modern operating systems.

#### Examples

##### Basic usage

```puppet
include antelope
```

##### With real-time system directories

```puppet
class { 'antelope':
  dirs => ['/rtsystems/usarray', '/rtsystems/ci'],
}
```

##### Multiple instances

```puppet
class { 'antelope':
  instances => {
    'antelope-primary' => {
      user => 'rt',
      dirs => '/rtsystems/primary',
    },
    'antelope-backup' => {
      user => 'rtbackup',
      dirs => '/rtsystems/backup',
    },
  },
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope` class:

* [`absent`](#-antelope--absent)
* [`debug`](#-antelope--debug)
* [`disable`](#-antelope--disable)
* [`disableboot`](#-antelope--disableboot)
* [`audit_only`](#-antelope--audit_only)
* [`instance_subscribe`](#-antelope--instance_subscribe)
* [`user`](#-antelope--user)
* [`group`](#-antelope--group)
* [`service_name`](#-antelope--service_name)
* [`manage_service_fact`](#-antelope--manage_service_fact)
* [`manage_rtsystemdirs`](#-antelope--manage_rtsystemdirs)
* [`facts_dir`](#-antelope--facts_dir)
* [`delay`](#-antelope--delay)
* [`shutdownwait`](#-antelope--shutdownwait)
* [`dist_owner`](#-antelope--dist_owner)
* [`dist_group`](#-antelope--dist_group)
* [`dist_mode`](#-antelope--dist_mode)
* [`version`](#-antelope--version)
* [`service_provider`](#-antelope--service_provider)
* [`dirs`](#-antelope--dirs)
* [`instances`](#-antelope--instances)

##### <a name="-antelope--absent"></a>`absent`

Data type: `Boolean`

Ensure Antelope is not installed when true

##### <a name="-antelope--debug"></a>`debug`

Data type: `Boolean`

Enable debugging options

##### <a name="-antelope--disable"></a>`disable`

Data type: `Boolean`

Don't start services and remove init scripts

##### <a name="-antelope--disableboot"></a>`disableboot`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install init scripts but disable them at boot

##### <a name="-antelope--audit_only"></a>`audit_only`

Data type: `Boolean`

Make no changes to the system, only track changes

##### <a name="-antelope--instance_subscribe"></a>`instance_subscribe`

Data type: `Array`

Array of resources that will cause Antelope service restart

##### <a name="-antelope--user"></a>`user`

Data type: `Antelope::User`

Username that Antelope real-time systems should run as

##### <a name="-antelope--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Antelope::Group`

Group that Antelope should run as

##### <a name="-antelope--service_name"></a>`service_name`

Data type: `String`

Name of the Antelope service

##### <a name="-antelope--manage_service_fact"></a>`manage_service_fact`

Data type: `Boolean`

Create antelope_services fact when true

##### <a name="-antelope--manage_rtsystemdirs"></a>`manage_rtsystemdirs`

Data type: `Boolean`

Manage permissions in real-time system directories

##### <a name="-antelope--facts_dir"></a>`facts_dir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Path to facter facts.d directory

##### <a name="-antelope--delay"></a>`delay`

Data type: `Integer`

Seconds to delay between service startups

##### <a name="-antelope--shutdownwait"></a>`shutdownwait`

Data type: `Integer`

Timeout in seconds for service shutdown

##### <a name="-antelope--dist_owner"></a>`dist_owner`

Data type: `Antelope::User`

User that should own files in ANTELOPE tree

##### <a name="-antelope--dist_group"></a>`dist_group`

Data type: `Antelope::Group`

Group that should own files in ANTELOPE tree

##### <a name="-antelope--dist_mode"></a>`dist_mode`

Data type: `String`

File mode for files in ANTELOPE tree

##### <a name="-antelope--version"></a>`version`

Data type: `Antelope::Version`

Antelope version to use (defaults to latest detected)

Default value: `pick($facts['antelope_latest_version'], '5.15')`

##### <a name="-antelope--service_provider"></a>`service_provider`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Override default service provider (systemd/redhat)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--dirs"></a>`dirs`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Dirs]`

Directories to manage as Antelope real-time systems.
Mutually exclusive with instances parameter.

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instances"></a>`instances`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Instances]`

Hash of antelope::instance resources to create.
Mutually exclusive with dirs parameter.

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="antelope--mco"></a>`antelope::mco`

This class installs MCollective plugins for Antelope on systems with
Antelope installed. These plugins allow remote management of Antelope
services via MCollective.

#### Examples

##### Install MCollective plugins

```puppet
include antelope::mco
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::mco` class:

* [`plugin_basedir`](#-antelope--mco--plugin_basedir)
* [`mco_etc`](#-antelope--mco--mco_etc)
* [`ensure`](#-antelope--mco--ensure)
* [`owner`](#-antelope--mco--owner)
* [`group`](#-antelope--mco--group)
* [`mode`](#-antelope--mco--mode)
* [`client_only`](#-antelope--mco--client_only)

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--plugin_basedir"></a>`plugin_basedir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Directory where MCollective plugins are stored (libdir)

Default value: `'/usr/libexec/mcollective'`

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--mco_etc"></a>`mco_etc`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Directory where MCollective config files are kept

Default value: `'/etc/mcollective'`

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Whether the plugins should be present or absent

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `Antelope::User`

File owner for installed plugins

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Antelope::Group`

File group for installed plugins

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `String`

File mode for installed plugins

Default value: `'0644'`

##### <a name="-antelope--mco--client_only"></a>`client_only`

Data type: `Boolean`

Install only client plugins when true

Default value: `false`

### <a name="antelope--service_fact"></a>`antelope::service_fact`

This class sets up a basic concat resource that other classes can add to
in order to build the antelope_services fact. The fact contains a comma-separated
list of all Antelope service instances.

#### Examples

##### Basic usage

```puppet
include antelope::service_fact
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::service_fact` class:

* [`facts_dir`](#-antelope--service_fact--facts_dir)

##### <a name="-antelope--service_fact--facts_dir"></a>`facts_dir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Path to the facter facts.d directory

### <a name="antelope--sync"></a>`antelope::sync`

This class creates an rsync-based synchronization script for copying an
existing golden master Antelope installation. The script supports both
rsync:// protocol and rsync over SSH.

#### Examples

##### Basic synchronization setup

```puppet
class { 'antelope::sync':
  host => 'build.example.com',
}
```

##### With site-specific tree

```puppet
class { 'antelope::sync':
  host      => 'rsync://build.example.com',
  site_tree => '/opt/anf',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::sync` class:

* [`ensure`](#-antelope--sync--ensure)
* [`user`](#-antelope--sync--user)
* [`owner`](#-antelope--sync--owner)
* [`group`](#-antelope--sync--group)
* [`exec_mode`](#-antelope--sync--exec_mode)
* [`data_mode`](#-antelope--sync--data_mode)
* [`basedir`](#-antelope--sync--basedir)
* [`rsync_bin`](#-antelope--sync--rsync_bin)
* [`site_tree`](#-antelope--sync--site_tree)
* [`host`](#-antelope--sync--host)

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Whether files should be present or absent on the filesystem

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--user"></a>`user`

Data type: `Antelope::User`

Username for the rsync command (source system)

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `Antelope::User`

Local file owner for created files

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Antelope::Group`

Local file group for created files

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--exec_mode"></a>`exec_mode`

Data type: `String`

File mode for executable files

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--data_mode"></a>`data_mode`

Data type: `String`

File mode for data files

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--basedir"></a>`basedir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Base directory for installing sync scripts

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--rsync_bin"></a>`rsync_bin`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Path to the rsync binary

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--site_tree"></a>`site_tree`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Optional site-local Antelope tree to synchronize

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--sync--host"></a>`host`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Synchost]`

Source hostname for rsync (required when ensure is present)

Default value: `undef`

## Defined types

### <a name="antelope--instance"></a>`antelope::instance`

This defined type creates an Antelope service instance with associated
init scripts and manages permissions for real-time system directories.

#### Examples

##### Two real-time systems under user rt

```puppet
antelope::instance { 'antelope':
  dirs => ['/rtsystems/usarray', '/rtsystems/roadnet'],
}
```

##### Single real-time system with subscriptions

```puppet
antelope::instance { 'antelope-rtida':
  dirs          => '/rtsystems/ida',
  user          => 'rtida',
  subscriptions => [Service['automounter']],
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::instance` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-antelope--instance--ensure)
* [`user`](#-antelope--instance--user)
* [`delay`](#-antelope--instance--delay)
* [`shutdownwait`](#-antelope--instance--shutdownwait)
* [`subscriptions`](#-antelope--instance--subscriptions)
* [`servicename`](#-antelope--instance--servicename)
* [`dirs`](#-antelope--instance--dirs)
* [`group`](#-antelope--instance--group)
* [`manage_fact`](#-antelope--instance--manage_fact)
* [`manage_rtsystemdirs`](#-antelope--instance--manage_rtsystemdirs)

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['present', 'absent']]`

Whether the service should be present or absent

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--user"></a>`user`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::User]`

Username that the Antelope real-time systems should run as

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--delay"></a>`delay`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Number of seconds to delay between startups

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--shutdownwait"></a>`shutdownwait`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

How long to wait in seconds for real-time system shutdown

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--subscriptions"></a>`subscriptions`

Data type: `Optional[Array]`

Array of resources that will cause this instance to stop/restart

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--servicename"></a>`servicename`

Data type: `String`

Name of the init script (defaults to title)

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--dirs"></a>`dirs`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Dirs]`

List of directories containing real-time systems

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Group]`

Group that Antelope should run as

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--manage_fact"></a>`manage_fact`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether to manage the antelope_services fact

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--instance--manage_rtsystemdirs"></a>`manage_rtsystemdirs`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether to manage permissions in real-time system directories

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="antelope--rtsystemdir"></a>`antelope::rtsystemdir`

This defined type manages permissions for files and directories within
an Antelope real-time system directory, specifically focusing on the
rtexec.pf file permissions.

#### Examples

##### Manage permissions for a real-time system

```puppet
antelope::rtsystemdir { '/export/home/rt/rtsystems/foo':
  owner => 'rt',
  group => 'rt',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::rtsystemdir` defined type:

* [`owner`](#-antelope--rtsystemdir--owner)
* [`group`](#-antelope--rtsystemdir--group)
* [`dir_mode`](#-antelope--rtsystemdir--dir_mode)
* [`rtexec_mode`](#-antelope--rtsystemdir--rtexec_mode)
* [`path`](#-antelope--rtsystemdir--path)

##### <a name="-antelope--rtsystemdir--owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::User]`

The username that the real-time system should run as

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--rtsystemdir--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Group]`

The group that the real-time system should run as

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--rtsystemdir--dir_mode"></a>`dir_mode`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

File mode for directories in the real-time system

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--rtsystemdir--rtexec_mode"></a>`rtexec_mode`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

File mode for the rtexec.pf file

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--rtsystemdir--path"></a>`path`

Data type: `String`

The path to the real-time system directory (defaults to title)

Default value: `$title`

### <a name="antelope--versioned_license_pf"></a>`antelope::versioned_license_pf`

This defined type creates a license.pf parameter file for a particular version
of Antelope. Multiple instances can be created for different versions to
support testing scenarios.

#### Examples

##### Set the license.pf for the latest version of Antelope

```puppet
antelope::versioned_license_pf { $facts['antelope_latest_version']:
  license_keys => [
    'tabcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef12 2014 May 01 # node foo',
    'tbbadef1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef12 2014 May 01 # node bar',
  ],
  replace => true,
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::versioned_license_pf` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--ensure)
* [`replace`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--replace)
* [`expiration_warnings`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--expiration_warnings)
* [`owner`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--owner)
* [`group`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--group)
* [`mode`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--mode)
* [`version`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--version)
* [`path`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--path)
* [`source`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--source)
* [`content`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--content)
* [`license_keys`](#-antelope--versioned_license_pf--license_keys)

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Whether the license.pf file should be present or absent

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--replace"></a>`replace`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether to replace the contents if the file exists

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--expiration_warnings"></a>`expiration_warnings`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether to show expiration warnings in license.pf

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::User]`

File owner

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Group]`

File group

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

File mode

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--version"></a>`version`

Data type: `Antelope::Version`

Antelope version (defaults to title)

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--path"></a>`path`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Override default file path

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Source file to copy (mutually exclusive with content)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

File content (mutually exclusive with source)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_license_pf--license_keys"></a>`license_keys`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[String, Array]]`

Array containing license keys, one per array element

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="antelope--versioned_site_pf"></a>`antelope::versioned_site_pf`

This defined type creates a site.pf parameter file for a particular version
of Antelope. Multiple instances can be created for different versions to
support testing scenarios.

#### Examples

##### Create site.pf for latest Antelope version

```puppet
antelope::versioned_site_pf { $facts['antelope_latest_version']:
  mailhost                 => 'smtp.example.com',
  mail_domain              => 'example.com',
  default_seed_network     => 'TA',
  originating_organization => 'Example University',
  institution              => 'EXMP',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `antelope::versioned_site_pf` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--ensure)
* [`mailhost`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--mailhost)
* [`mail_domain`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--mail_domain)
* [`default_seed_network`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--default_seed_network)
* [`originating_organization`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--originating_organization)
* [`institution`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--institution)
* [`version`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--version)
* [`source`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--source)
* [`content`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--content)
* [`owner`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--owner)
* [`group`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--group)
* [`mode`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--mode)
* [`path`](#-antelope--versioned_site_pf--path)

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Whether the site.pf file should be present or absent

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--mailhost"></a>`mailhost`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Hostname or IP address of mail relay agent

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--mail_domain"></a>`mail_domain`

Data type: `Stdlib::Fqdn`

Domain name for outgoing mail (defaults to FQDN)

Default value: `$facts['networking']['fqdn']`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--default_seed_network"></a>`default_seed_network`

Data type: `String`

Network code used in miniseed headers (officially assigned)

Default value: `'XX'`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--originating_organization"></a>`originating_organization`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Organization name for SEED volumes

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--institution"></a>`institution`

Data type: `String`

Short institution code for origin table author field

Default value: `'XXXX'`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--version"></a>`version`

Data type: `Antelope::Version`

Antelope version (defaults to title)

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Source file to copy (mutually exclusive with content)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

File content (mutually exclusive with source)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::User]`

File owner

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Optional[Antelope::Group]`

File group

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

File mode

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-antelope--versioned_site_pf--path"></a>`path`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::Absolutepath]`

Override default file path

Default value: `undef`

## Data types

### <a name="Antelope--Dirs"></a>`Antelope::Dirs`

This type accepts either a single absolute path or an array of absolute paths
representing directories that contain Antelope real-time systems.

#### Examples

##### Single directory

```puppet
'/rtsystems/usarray'
```

##### Multiple directories

```puppet
['/rtsystems/usarray', '/rtsystems/ci']
```

Alias of `Variant[Stdlib::Absolutepath, Array[Stdlib::Absolutepath]]`

### <a name="Antelope--Group"></a>`Antelope::Group`

This type accepts either a group name as a string or a numeric group ID (GID)
in the range 0-65535. Used throughout the Antelope module for specifying
which group should own files and run processes.

#### Examples

##### Group name as string

```puppet
'rt'
```

##### Numeric GID

```puppet
1000
```

Alias of `Variant[String, Integer[0, 65535]]`

### <a name="Antelope--Instances"></a>`Antelope::Instances`

This type defines a hash structure for configuring multiple Antelope instances
through the main antelope class. Each key is the instance name, and the value
is a struct containing configuration parameters for that instance.

#### Examples

##### Multiple instances

```puppet
{
  'antelope-primary' => {
    user => 'rt',
    dirs => '/rtsystems/primary',
    delay => 5,
  },
  'antelope-backup' => {
    user => 'rtbackup',
    dirs => '/rtsystems/backup',
    manage_fact => false,
  },
}
```

Alias of

```puppet
Hash[String, Struct[{
      Optional[ensure]              => Enum['present', 'absent'],
      Optional[dirs]                => Antelope::Dirs,
      Optional[user]                => Antelope::User,
      Optional[group]               => Antelope::Group,
      Optional[delay]               => Integer,
      Optional[shutdownwait]        => Integer,
      Optional[manage_fact]         => Boolean,
      Optional[manage_rtsystemdirs] => Boolean,
      Optional[subscriptions]       => Array
}]]
```

### <a name="Antelope--Synchost"></a>`Antelope::Synchost`

This type validates hostnames that can be used with rsync for synchronizing
Antelope installations. It accepts standard hostnames and optionally allows
the 'rsync://' protocol prefix for rsync daemon connections.

#### Examples

##### Standard hostname

```puppet
'build.example.com'
```

##### With rsync protocol

```puppet
'rsync://build.example.com'
```

Alias of `Pattern[/\A((rsync:\/\/|)([a-zA-Z0-9]|[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9\-]*[a-zA-Z0-9])\.)*([A-Za-z0-9]|[A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9\-]*[A-Za-z0-9])\z/]`

### <a name="Antelope--User"></a>`Antelope::User`

This type accepts either a username as a string or a numeric user ID (UID)
in the range 0-65535. Used throughout the Antelope module for specifying
which user should own files and run processes.

#### Examples

##### Username as string

```puppet
'rt'
```

##### Numeric UID

```puppet
1000
```

Alias of `Variant[String, Integer[0, 65535]]`

### <a name="Antelope--Version"></a>`Antelope::Version`

This type validates Antelope version strings. It accepts versions from 4.x
through 9.x with optional suffixes like 'pre', 'post', '-64', '-64p', or 'p'.
The module supports Antelope versions 5.9 through 5.15.

#### Examples

##### Standard version

```puppet
'5.15'
```

##### Version with suffix

```puppet
'5.2-64'
```

Alias of `Pattern[/^[4-9]\.[0-9]+(pre|post|-64|-64p|p)?$/]`
